channel.title: Webclient compile error illage charture
channel.description: .\sign\signlink.java:152: illegal escape character String s = "C:\Curtis_server\evolved_cache_32"; ^ .\sign\signlink.java:152: illegal escape character String s = "C:\Curtis_server\evolved_cache_32"; ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: Webclient compile error illage charture
item.dc:creator: @oniscape oniscape
item.description:
@oniscape wrote:

The character “” can not be used in Java unless you type “\”
Basically “\” = “” in Java, when used in strings. So change it to:

String s = "C:\\Curtis_server\\evolved_cache_32";

and it will work.

Read full topic
